content:
@Johan Commelin thanks! I understand the issue and what the // notation means, I'll try that.
But I never came across the .1 / .2 notation; could you explain me what it is used for?
They are the first bit and second bit of a structure. Here, subtype is the structure so x.1 corresponds to the element and x.2 to the associated proof.
If x : \a \prod \b, then x.1 : \a and x.2 : \b are the components of x
Okay it's all good, thanks a lot for your incredible reaction time!
Loïc Simon has marked this topic as resolved.
